message_1: In a group of 7 people, how many different ways can you select a committee of 3 people?
message_2:
To solve this problem, we will use the combination formula, which is:

C(n, k) = n! / (k!(n-k)!)

where n is the total number of people, k is the number of people we want to select, and ! denotes the factorial of a number.

In this case, n = 7 (total number of people) and k = 3 (number of people to select for the committee).

C(7, 3) = 7! / (3!(7-3)!)

C(7, 3) = 7! / (3!4!)

C(7, 3) = (7 × 6 × 5 × 4 × 3 × 2 × 1) / ((3 × 2 × 1)(4 × 3 × 2 × 1))

C(7, 3) = (7 × 6 × 5) / (3 × 2 × 1)

C(7, 3) = 210 / 6

C(7, 3) = 35

So, there are 35 different ways to select a committee of 3 people from a group of 7 people.
